reviews.text: No issues with this station- plenty of connections to high speed trains.

This is a good station if you are connecting to a LNER train. Otherwise, there can be problems with the accuracy of the display boards. I was travelling recently and booked into Coach A (First Class) on a CrossCountry train. The information board showed coaches 1 to 9 (numbers and not letters) with First Class in Coaches 1 and 9. Station staff were unable to tell me if Coach A was at the front or the back of the train. I was advised to wait near the front. On arrival of the train, I was told that Coach A was at the back. So, I ran down the train, with heavy luggage, only to be told that Coach A was in the middle!! Eventually, I arrived at the correct coach, exhausted, only to be berated by train staff for keeping the train waiting!!! I am sure LNER staff will put the blame on CrossCountry Staff for the confusion and vice-versa. That's life these days.
A good place to go trainspotting and can get to loads of places. The touch screen boards with all information will always help.
Was just passing through. Seemed quite large with decent facilities.
